definition: to wave the hand (to say goodbye, or in a negative gesture)/crank handle
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: In china waving hands means saying goodbye.
sentences.chinese: 在中国摇手表示说再见。

sentences.english: All who pass by her scoff and shake their fists.
sentences.chinese: 凡经过的人都必摇手嗤笑她。

sentences.english: She has a habit of waving her hand around --do you know?
sentences.chinese: 你知道她有个摇手的习惯吗？

sentences.english: Nestled inside a wooden bucket, there's a metal canister with a hand crank on top.
sentences.chinese: 内置木桶，顶部是一个金属的曲柄摇手。

sentences.english: They will just wave "good-bay" to the whole group.
sentences.chinese: 他们对整个团体只摇手说“再见”。

definition: to wave one's hand/to gesture with one's hand (beckoning, waving good-bye etc)/to swing one's arms
to laugh in spite of oneself/to be unable to help laughing/to break into laughter
to give a hollow laugh/to force a smile/forced laugh/CL:聲|声[sheng1]
in a great rush/in a flurry
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
